author: MSNBC.com
title: Lt. Gen. Honor: 'If we don't discipline we'll have a mess on our hands.'
description: : Lt. Gen. Russel Honor, who led military relief efforts following Hurricane Katrina in 2005, talks to MSNBC's Ali Velshi on how the Trump admin. has responded to COVID-19 and the importance of coordinating local and federal resources.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Rep. Carter: ‘We have the best healthcare system in the world’
description: Republican Congressman Buddy Carter of Georgia explains why he’s still against universal healthcare despite other countries being “better prepared” for the coronavirus pandemic.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Velshi: Industry bailouts should be on OUR terms
description: MSNBC’s Ali Velshi on what taxpayers deserve for pulling airlines and other sectors out of the recession caused by the coronavirus pandemic.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Diane Swonk: The U.S. is losing jobs at an ‘unprecedented’ pace
description: Grant Thornton chief economist Diane Swonk discusses the need for a ‘stopgap’ program to fund the national coronavirus response amidst rising unemployment.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Gina McCarthy: ‘Climate change is also a huge vulnerability for us’
description: Former EPA administrator Gina McCarthy on why recovering from the coronavirus pandemic is an opportunity to better address climate change.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Sen. Rand Paul tests positive for COVID-19
description: Sen. Rand Paul R-Ky., tested positive for the coronavirus. He is the first member of the U.S. Senate to test positive for the virus and is being quarantined.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Doctor on coronavirus: Numbers are going to skyrocket
description: Coronavirus protections such as masks are in short supply, as doctors in New York City are reportedly actively looking for protective gear as the pandemic hits their city. Joy Reid and her panel discuss why protective gowns, masks, and more supplies are neede…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Gov. Cuomo on price gouging: "I'm competing against every other state"
description: During a press conference, NY Gov. Cuomo asks the federal government to help prevent price gouging amid the coronavirus pandemic.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: New York cases of COVID-19 rise to 15,000
description: During a press conference, New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo updates on the number of people positive for COVID-19.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Slavitt: Democrats and GOP need to and hammer out a deal
description: Andy Slavitt, the former Acting Administrator of the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services, says Democrats and Republicans need to get a coronavirus relief deal done, but that it must help low income Americans and healthcare workers.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Pelosi on coronavirus relief plan: Democrats will "be introducing our own bill’
description: Negotiations are underway on Capitol Hill for ‘phase three’ of the coronavirus stimulus package. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, D-Calif., said the Democrats will “be introducing our own bill.” While Sen. Mitch McConnell, R-Ky., expressed that Republicans are “ve…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: D.C. cherry blossoms draw crowds, mayor says 'stay home'
description: D.C. Mayor Muriel Bowser reacts to crowds coming out to see Washington D.C.'s cherry blossoms trees in bloom, despite warnings by the National Parks Service.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Sen. Klobuchar on 2020: Make early voting, mail voting the norm
description: Sen. Amy Klobuchar seeks to protect the 2020 elections with a bill that will make early voting and mai-inl voting the norm, and provide funding for states for this expansion. Klobuchar joins Joy Reid to discuss.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Sen. Booker on coronavirus bill: Number one concern is workers
description: The coronavirus pandemic’s economic fallout is discussed by Sen. Cory Booker (D-NJ) who tells Joy Reid that for him, regarding the coronavirus stimulus bill, ‘The number one concern is workers, workers, workers.’
source.name: MSNBC

title: Is your money safe in the banks right now?
description: With U.S. stock markets in decline amidst the COVID-19 outbreak, Sharon Epperson answers a viewer question: Is your money safe in the banks right now?
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Zimmern: Coronavirus pandemic 'reveals the flaws in every single piece of the system'
description: Chef Andrew Zimmern discusses how the COVID-19 outbreak has exposed flaws in American society, from healthcare to food policies and supply chains.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Americans stranded abroad amid coronavirus outbreak
description: NBC News' Steve Patterson explains how the US State Department is trying to resolve the issue of Americans stranded abroad as countries begin to close their borders amidst the COVID-19 pandemic.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Why are NY liquor stores allowed to stay open?
description: Tonight, New York will be shutting down all businesses deemed non-essential. MSNBC's Lindsey Reiser explains why liquor stores have labeled essential and will remain open.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Rob Reiner and Max Brooks stress need for social distancing
description: Coronavirus social distancing is promoted by director, actor and activist Rob Reiner and actor and author Max Brooks--who also discuss using comedy to cope with coronavirus--in conversation with Joy Reid.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: 'We are allowed to go outside': Dr. Azar shares tips for quelling anxiety while stuck at home
description: Dr. Natalie Azar shares her tips for quelling anxiety for people stuck at home as more states issue stay-at-home orders amidst the coronavirus pandemic.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: First federal inmate tests positive for coronavirus in NYC
description: The federal bureau of Prisons announced that the first federal inmate tested positive for coronavirus. According to the agency, the inmate remains in isolation at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn. Inmates that were near the COVID-19 positive pris…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: If you think you had COVID-19, how long should you self-isolate?
description: Dr. Natalie Azar answers a viewer question: If you believe you've had coronavirus, how long should you self-isolate?
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: ‘We’re scared’: Cancer patient describes hospital visits amid coronavirus outbreak
description:
Sheetal Sheth speaks about what it's like to undergo treatment for breast cancer amidst the coronavirus outbreak.

"We're having to decide what's worse for us, coronavirus or the cancer, every time we go into the hospital, as you mentioned, we're immunocompro…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Watch Trump react after learning Mitt Romney is self-isolating
description: During a press briefing on the coronavirus pandemic, President Trump learns that GOP rival Sen. Mitt Romney is self isolating and says “gee, that’s too bad.”
source.name: MSNBC
